notesStmt.note: First folio is partially damaged. Several pages are water-stained.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A commentary on the book of Psalms by Yosef ben Avraham Ḥayun.

supportDesc.foliation: No folio 181 (number missed by original folio creator).

collation.p: Quires of mostly 12 leaves each. Catchwords on every verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of approximately 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Joseph Chaiyun. Perush Tehillim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26902.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 11; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed (folio [211v]).
